title: Med Airways
text:
Med Airways was a small <a href="Lebanon">Lebanese</a> <a href="air%20charter">charter airline</a>. It ceased all operations in 2015.
History and profile.
It was named as Flying Carpet until 2009. Its fleet consisted of one <a href="Fairchild%20Swearingen%20Metroliner">Swearingen SA-227 Metro</a> 19-seat <a href="turboprop">turboprop</a> airplane, one Piper PA-28, one Piper PA-32 and one Piper PA-34. In 2006 it received two <a href="Boeing%20737-200">Boeing 737-200</a> formerly owned by <a href="Southwest%20Airlines">Southwest Airlines</a> and <a href="Delta%20Air%20Lines">Delta Air Lines</a> and later received a <a href="Bombardier%20Aerospace">Bombardier</a> <a href="Bombardier%20CRJ200">CRJ-200ER</a> formerly owned by <a href="Independence%20Air">Independence Air</a>. In 2009 the name was changed to Med Airways.
